FAQ.question: How can I participate in an ongoing Bid for a product/service which has not been uploaded?
FAQ.answer: You will have to check the Bid details and upload the product/service offering. Once the product/service is approved on GeM, you can participate in the ongoing Bid.

FAQ.question: On what amount EPBG and EMD is applicable?
FAQ.answer: If the estimated bid value is above Rs. 5 lakhs, EPBG is applicable and if the estimated bid value is above 5 lakhs, EMD is applicable. This is applicable for both, products and services.

FAQ.question: If I do not receive any notification on my mobile/email regarding any particular Bid for which I offer service or product, can I participate in that Bid?
FAQ.answer: Yes, you can participate in that Bid, if the product or service offered by you is approved on GeM and "Participate" button is visible to you.

FAQ.question: Are Bids inclusive of GST?
FAQ.answer: Yes, the offer submitted by the seller/service provider at the time of Bid participation is inclusive of GST.

FAQ.question: What is Bunch Bid?
FAQ.answer: Bunch Bid is grouping of connected products or services in a single Bid.

FAQ.question: How to participate in Bunch Bid?
FAQ.answer: Login to your account and click on "Bids", then click on "Bunch Bid" option to view all Bunch Bids. Select the Bunch Bid you want to participate in and click on "Participate" button.

FAQ.question: Is it possible to add/edit technical specification(s) while participating in Bunch Bid?
FAQ.answer: No, you cannot add or edit technical specification(s) while participating in a Bunch Bid.

FAQ.question: Is it possible to edit the offer price while participating in a Bunch Bid?
FAQ.answer: Yes, you can edit the offer price on a product unless it has been encrypted before.

FAQ.question: Under Buyer Details, what does "Buyer Payment Status: Orange" indicate?
FAQ.answer: "Buyer Payment Status: Orange" is mentioned against those Buyers who have not released payments of more than 20 orders and CRAC has been generated for more than 70 days.

FAQ.question: Under Buyer Details, what does "Buyer Payment Status: Red" indicate?
FAQ.answer: "Buyer Payment Status: Red" is mentioned against those Buyers who have not released payments of more than 30 orders and CRAC has been generated for more than 70 days.

FAQ.question: Can active contracts be counted in years of experience with govt. (For ex- a contract running from last 5 years)?
FAQ.answer: Yes, all active contracts would be counted under years of experience.

FAQ.question: What is the turnover condition for sellers to participate in the bid?
FAQ.answer: Turnover criteria as eligibility for bid participation is decided by the buyer. GeM has capped the required turnover at 0.5 times the estimated value of the Bid.

FAQ.question: Is Annual turnover and Experience with Government criteria exempted for Small/medium/startup companies?
FAQ.answer: The buyer may chose for such an exemption in bid. If exempted, Registered MSEs and Startups are exempted from turnover and experience conditions, the same is mentioned in the Bid document.

FAQ.question: Can sellers raise a representation against a rejected Bid?
FAQ.answer: Bidders, whose Bids have been disqualified in technical evaluation may review the reason(s) for rejection by the Buyer and raise a one-time representation to challenge the rejection for disqualification within 48 hours after technical evaluation is completed. Buyer shall respond to all such representations before proceeding with the Financial Bid Opening.

FAQ.question: How do Sellers add the PVC rates?
FAQ.answer: On the Invoice page, Sellers have an option to update this “Unit Price” (PVC revised rates) against the Bid/RA order for which PVC is applicable.Sellers can also provide the item wise revised price along with the supporting document.

FAQ.question: DO I need to have a Category/Catalogue uploaded in the CMS for Participation in Tender/Bids published in GeM.
FAQ.answer: No, a Seller need not have to upload or have an offering in the Market place few participations in BOQ based bidding.

FAQ.question: Can every Seller participate in BOQ based bidding?
FAQ.answer: Yes, any Registered Seller of GeM can participate in the BOQ base bidding.

FAQ.question: In bunch bid of BOQ with Category/Catalogue based Products can every Seller participate in the Tender Published?
FAQ.answer: No, only those Sellers/Bidders can participate who have offered their catalogues in the categories of the Products that are bunched with items of the BOQ.

FAQ.question: Is splitting applicable in BOQ based bidding?
FAQ.answer: No, splitting is not applicable for this functionality as Quantity by default is set as '1'.

FAQ.question: I am a Registered Seller of GeM. Shall I get notifications incase BOQ based Tender is Published?
FAQ.answer: Depending on the category selection by the Buyer in which he/she has an option of selection of three number of categories closest to the BOQ items to be procured, any Seller which falls under these selected categories put under display would receive the Tender Publish notification.

FAQ.question: I am a Seller trying to provide specifications in a BOQ based bidding. Where can I upload my specifications for buyer scrutiny/evaluation.
FAQ.answer: A Seller can add Technical specifications along with any other relevant Catalogue details in the section 'Compliance to BOQ Specification & supporting documents'.

FAQ.question: Can Seller able to submit Revised Prices for the L1 negotiation request made by the Buyer?
FAQ.answer: Yes, L1 Seller shall be able to upload a revised BOQ in the system and submit the Revised/Final prices as the case maybe.

FAQ.question: I am a Seller, in case I am declared as a L1 bidder and Buyer request for further price negotiation, do I have to refill the BOQ sheet?
FAQ.answer: Yes, Seller has to revise the prices in the BOQ excel sheet and upload the same during negotiation process if at all called for by the Buyer.

FAQ.question: Will the Contract document capture price break up of the BOQ based bidding system?
FAQ.answer: Yes, the Contract document shall contain the individual line item break up along with Price, Consignee and Delivery Period details.

FAQ.question: I am a Seller(L1), Buyer has sent me a negotiation request. What is the time frame within which I must my Revised price?
FAQ.answer: Seller shall get a time duration of 72 hours to submit the Revised price(s).

FAQ.question: I am a Seller (L1), Buyer has sent L1 negotiation request. Where do I get to view the same?
FAQ.answer: Seller gets to view the L1 negotiation request against the Participated Bid in discussion with a message “Update Final Price: Click here”.

FAQ.question: I am a Seller (L1), Buyer has sent me negotiation request, it is possible to view my current offered price and then update the revised price?
FAQ.answer: Yes, a Seller can review the current price and then offer New/Revised price(s).

FAQ.question: I am a Seller; Buyer has sent me L1 price negotiation request. Do I have to update & add the unit price or the total price? The prices have to be all inclusive including GST?
FAQ.answer: Yes, Seller has to revise and offer unit price. This unit price shall be all inclusive including GST. System shall auto calculate Total negotiated Price ( all-inclusive incl. GST).

FAQ.question: I am Seller, Buyer has sent me L1 negotiation request. I have submitted Revised price. However, I feel I need to withdraw or change/edit my Revised price(s) offered. Can I do so?
FAQ.answer: No, a Revised price once offered/submitted cannot be withdraw or edited.

FAQ.question: Can a bidder represent against technical disqualification of his bid by the buyer?
FAQ.answer: As per clause 7.4.2 of Manual for Procurement of Goods 2017 (Right of Bidder to question rejection at Techno-Commercial Stage) the Bidder has the right to question rejection at Techno-Commercial Stage in case he feels that a proper procurement process is not being followed and/or his techno-commercial bid has been rejected wrongly. However, the bidders’ representations should be considered within the ambit of provisions of Clause 7.3.5 of Manual for Procurement of Goods 2017. The bidders can submit such representations against technical disqualification by the buyer online on GeM portal.

FAQ.question: I am a Seller, Buyer has selected Input Tax Credit (ITC) in the Bid, what price do I have to enter in the System-All inclusive including GST component or exclusive of GST?
FAQ.answer: Seller shall have to enter Prices inclusive of all taxes including GST during participation in Bids.However provision is made in the system for the Seller to add/input the applicable GST amount in percentage along with GST Cess where ever applicable separately.

FAQ.question: During Seller Participation, few Sellers are unable to enter GST % & GST Cess % in the Price Offer, why is this so?
FAQ.answer: If Seller is unregistered under GST, & Buyer has chosen RCM, Seller will not be able to enter GST, GST Cess 1 (Percentage) & GST Cess 2 (Quantum).Liability of payment of GST and GST cess is in Buyer’s scope. GST and GST cess as indicated by the buyer in the bid document will be applicable, and payment of GST and GST Cess will be the liability of the Buyer. Else, also if Seller is under Composition Scheme, there is no liability of payment of GST and GST cess either on the Seller or Buyer [A composite vendor neither collects tax from the recipient of supplies nor passes on any credit of input tax. Hence, no GST is computed if the purchases are made from a composite vendor].

FAQ.question: Can I take part in few items from the BOQ file since I am unable to offer all the products of the Tender/ Bid?
FAQ.answer: If the Type of Evaluation method is Schedule wise (Item wise/Group wise) then you may participate in one schedule while prefer not to quote for remaining schedules.However you shall have to quote for all the items present in a particular schedule without skipping any.

FAQ.question: Which type of BOQ File can a Buyer/Seller upload for filling the BOQ Priced sheet. What is its File Size?
FAQ.answer: Upload File type shall be CSV Type & File Size is up to 10 MB.

FAQ.question: I have entered the value in class 1 but field for entering value in class 2 does not appear?
FAQ.answer: Class 1 and Class 2 local content pop up come by default. In case, bid is MII reserved then class 2 local content field not required hence not appear

FAQ.question: As a Seller, I am not able to participate in Bid as class 1 Seller?
FAQ.answer: Seller needs to check the MII content of the catalogue being offered in the bid. In case this being less than the value of the MII content defined then the Buyer shall not be able to participate. In case of Bunch bids, only the local content of item belonging to the Primary category is checked.

FAQ.question: What is the time limit for challenge rejection window in case of Covid categories?
FAQ.answer: The time limit for challenge rejection window is 24 hrs. in case of Covid categories.

FAQ.question: What is the difference between Technical Offering & Financial Offering?
FAQ.answer: · Technical Offering : In this, sellers are required to submit their technical offering without quoting price. · Financial Offering : All sellers who are technically qualified will be invited to submit their prices and participate in the RA.

FAQ.question: How to participate in RA – Technical Offering?
FAQ.answer: Login to your account and click on Ongoing Bids/RA through Bids. Search the RA by using the RA item or RA Number. Click on 'Participate'. Select your product & cross-check Technical Bid Specifications and save. Verify your bid by clicking on "Verify OTP".

FAQ.question: How to participate in RA – Financial Offering?
FAQ.answer: Login to your account and click on Ongoing Bids/ RA through Bids. Now search your RA by using the RA item or RA Number. Click on 'Offer Price' and complete OTP verification. Enter your product/ service price at per unit level & save it. Revise and submit prices in compliance with RA decrement rules.

FAQ.question: Is it possible to add/ edit technical specification in RA once verified using OTP?
FAQ.answer: No, it is not possible to add/ edit technical specification in RA, once technical offering has been verified.

FAQ.question: Is it possible for me to check a consignee location in RA?
FAQ.answer: Yes, you can download the RA document where all the RA related information and consignee details are available.

FAQ.question: What happens if a RA price is offered very close to the RA end time?
FAQ.answer: If you participate in the last 15 minutes of RA end time, the system will auto extend RA by 15 minutes. The number of extensions will be as per the buyer’s selection i.e. a minimum of 3 times. Any RA price submission after the RA end time will not be recorded.

FAQ.question: Is it possible to re-participate in a RA?
FAQ.answer: Yes, it is possible to re-participate in RA by reducing prices in accordance with RA decrement rules.

FAQ.question: I am a Seller, Buyer has selected Input Tax Credit (ITC) in the Bid, what price do I have to enter in the System-All inclusive including GST component or exclusive of GST?
FAQ.answer: Seller shall have to enter Prices inclusive of all taxes including GST during participation in Bids.However provision is made in the system for the Seller to add/input the applicable GST amount in percentage along with GST Cess where ever applicable separately.

FAQ.question: During Seller Participation, few Sellers are unable to enter GST % & GST Cess % in the Price Offer, why is this so?
FAQ.answer: If Seller is unregistered under GST, & Buyer has chosen RCM, Seller will not be able to enter GST, GST Cess 1 (Percentage) & GST Cess 2 (Quantum).Liability of payment of GST and GST cess is in Buyer’s scope. GST and GST cess as indicated by the buyer in the bid document will be applicable, and payment of GST and GST Cess will be the liability of the Buyer. Else, also if Seller is under Composition Scheme, there is no liability of payment of GST and GST cess either on the Seller or Buyer [A composite vendor neither collects tax from the recipient of supplies nor passes on any credit of input tax. Hence, no GST is computed if the purchases are made from a composite vendor].

FAQ.question: Can I take part in few items from the BOQ file since I am unable to offer all the products of the Tender/ Bid?
FAQ.answer: If the Type of Evaluation method is Schedule wise (Item wise/Group wise) then you may participate in one schedule while prefer not to quote for remaining schedules.However you shall have to quote for all the items present in a particular schedule without skipping any.

FAQ.question: How is the reference price decided for a product or service in RA?
FAQ.answer: While converting BID to RA, L1 price of Bid is set as reference price for the RA.

FAQ.question: What happens if I submit prices within the last 15 minutes of the RA end time?
FAQ.answer: In this case RA will auto extend by 15 minutes. It can be extended from minimum 3 to maximum 10 times.

FAQ.question: Can a Seller/ Service Provider re-participate in a Bid/ RA after withdrawal?
FAQ.answer: Yes, Seller/Service Provider can re-participate in the Bid/RA after withdrawal. Re-participation is allowed only for a maximum 2 times.

FAQ.question: Is it possible to re-participate in Bid to RA?
FAQ.answer: Yes, it is possible to re-participate in Bid to RA by reducing prices in accordance with RA decrement rules.

FAQ.question: Why I have not received an invitation to participate in RA, despite technically qualifying for the Bid?
FAQ.answer: Only those Sellers whose price offering is amongst the top 50% of technically qualified sellers, will receive an invitation for RA participation.

FAQ.question: Bid to RA is not been enabled for a Bid, yet RA has been created. How?
FAQ.answer: In case of a tie for L1 position, Buyer has to mandatorily go for a RA.

FAQ.question: I am a Seller, Buyer has selected Input Tax Credit (ITC) in the Bid, what price do I have to enter in the System-All inclusive including GST component or exclusive of GST?
FAQ.answer: Seller shall have to enter Prices inclusive of all taxes including GST during participation in Bids.However provision is made in the system for the Seller to add/input the applicable GST amount in percentage along with GST Cess where ever applicable separately.

FAQ.question: During Seller Participation, few Sellers are unable to enter GST % & GST Cess % in the Price Offer, why is this so?
FAQ.answer: If Seller is unregistered under GST, & Buyer has chosen RCM, Seller will not be able to enter GST, GST Cess 1 (Percentage) & GST Cess 2 (Quantum).Liability of payment of GST and GST cess is in Buyer’s scope. GST and GST cess as indicated by the buyer in the bid document will be applicable, and payment of GST and GST Cess will be the liability of the Buyer. Else, also if Seller is under Composition Scheme, there is no liability of payment of GST and GST cess either on the Seller or Buyer [A composite vendor neither collects tax from the recipient of supplies nor passes on any credit of input tax. Hence, no GST is computed if the purchases are made from a composite vendor].

FAQ.question: Can I take part in few items from the BOQ file since I am unable to offer all the products of the Tender/ Bid?
FAQ.answer: If the Type of Evaluation method is Schedule wise (Item wise/Group wise) then you may participate in one schedule while prefer not to quote for remaining schedules.However you shall have to quote for all the items present in a particular schedule without skipping any.

FAQ.question: From where can I download a contract Document?
FAQ.answer: Please follow the steps mentioned below in order to download a contract: 1. Login with User Id & Password and submit 2. Click on 'Order' 3. Search your order number for which you want to download the contract and Click on 'View Details' 4. To download the contract, click on 'Download Contract'.

FAQ.question: Is it possible to select the billing address according to my billing location while generating the Invoice?
FAQ.answer: Seller can add their multiple billing addresses in the Profile page through Office Location tab, and can select, at the time of billing, the desired address amongst the addresses provided in Profile.

FAQ.question: Can I generate multiple invoices for any order?
FAQ.answer: Yes, you can generate multiple Invoices for an Order

FAQ.question: I am not able to find my billing address while creating invoice. What should I do now?
FAQ.answer: You should login to the account and select View Profile. You can update billing address under Office Location. Once the Billing Address is updated on your profile, the same would be available for selection while generating an Invoice.

FAQ.question: Where can I update the delivery date for the Shipment?
FAQ.answer: You can login to the account, click on the order for which delivery date needs to be updated and then click on "Shipment wise" to select the delivery date.

FAQ.question: Where can I download my Generated Invoices?
FAQ.answer: You can view the Generated Invoices in 'Shipmentwise' view avaliable in Order Details. Follow the Steps below to view an Invoice: 1. Login with User id and Password and submit 2. Click on 'Order' 3. Search your order number for which you want to view an invoice and click on 'View Details' 4. Click on 'Shipmentwise' option to view all the generated invoices for the selected Order. 5. Click on 'Download' option to download the Invoice

FAQ.question: Can I edit an Invoice?
FAQ.answer: Only Supplier Invoice Number, Mode of Dispatch and Billing address can be edited in an Invoice. Rest of the Information is non editable. If consignment get rejected during PRC/ CRAC then also you can generate supplementary invoice with updated information.

FAQ.question: What are the Steps to Regenerate an Invoice?
FAQ.answer: Please follow the steps mentioned below to generate an invoice: 1. Login with User id and Password and submit 2. Click on 'Order' 3. Search your order number for which you want to regenerate an invoice and click on 'View Details' 4. Click on 'Regenerate' option avaliable for an Invoice 5. Check all the details of the invoice and click on 'Regenerate'

FAQ.question: Where can I view the CRAC and Payment Details for an Invoice?
FAQ.answer: You can view the CRAC and Payment Details in 'Shipmentwise' view avaliable in Order Details. Follow the Steps below to view an Invoice: 1. Login with User id and Password and submit 2. Click on 'Order' 3. Search your order number for which you want to view an invoice and click on 'View Details' 4. Click on 'Shipmentwise' option to view all the generated invoices for the selected Order 5. Click on 'View Details' option to view the details of CRAC and Payment

FAQ.question: How can I Download the ePBG request document?
FAQ.answer: For Orders where the Buyer has asked for ePBG to be submitted, the ePBG Request document can be generated from Order details. Please follow the steps mentioned below : 1. Login with User id and Password and submit 2. Click on 'Order' 3. Search your order number for which you want to download the ePBG request document' 4. Click on 'Downlod' option avaliable in ePBG details section

FAQ.question: Where should I specify the ePBG details and upload the ePBG Scanned copy?
FAQ.answer: Once you receive the ePBG document from the Bank, you can upload the same in Order Details. Follow the steps below: 1. Login with User id and Password and submit 2. Click on 'Order' 3. Search your order number for which you want to Upload the ePBG document' 4. Click on verify option avaliable in ePBG details section 5. Specify the ePBG details and upload the document.

FAQ.question: What will happen if I do not upload the ePBG document?
FAQ.answer: The buyer has right to deduct the ePBG equivalent amount during Bill generation post CRAC.

FAQ.question: What is E-Invoicing?
FAQ.answer: Electronic invoicing refers to a method of processing invoices electronically, on a unified platform or between suppliers and buyers. The complete e-invoicing cycle is digital, from creation and transmission to processing and finalization on the buyer’s end. Currently, it is mandatory for all sellers whom annual turnover is more than 20Cr.

FAQ.question: Who all are exempted from the provisions of E-invoicing?
FAQ.answer: The following are exempted from the provisions of E-invoicing: • SEZ (Special Economic Zone units) • Financial institutions • Insurance companies • Banking sectors (including non-banking financial companies) • Goods transport agencies (GTAs) providing services solely for the   transportation of goods by road • Passenger transportation services, • Multiplexes

FAQ.question: Is E-Invoice declaration mandatory for all the sellers?
FAQ.answer: Yes, it is mandatory to provide the E-Invoice Declaration.

FAQ.question: What is the CBIC Guideline for e-Invoicing?
FAQ.answer: W.e.f 1st April 2022, e-invoicing is currently mandatory for registered persons whose aggregate turnover (based on PAN) in a financial year exceeds INR 20 Cr and it gets updated time to time.

FAQ.question: Can a Seller initiate DP amendment request for Orders with Staggered Delivery?
FAQ.answer: Yes Seller can initiate/raise as DP amendment request for Orders with Staggered Delivery yet this being applicable for Bid/RA Orders only.

FAQ.question: Can I book the shipment of the consignment (invoice) online via India Post?
FAQ.answer: Yes the shipment of the consignment can be booked online via India Post. GeM has integrated with India Post to facilitate the Sellers for the same

FAQ.question: What are the type of deliveries available to book the shipment via India Post
FAQ.answer: The seller can select either Pick up (the consignment to be picked up by India Post personnel) or Drop (the seller to drop the consignment at India Post Delivery Post office) as the type of delivery.

FAQ.question: Can the Seller ship multiple boxes as part of booking done with India Post?
FAQ.answer: Yes the Seller can ship multiple boxes as part of the booking being done with India Post for shipment of the consignment

FAQ.question: What is the maximum number of boxes which can be booked as part of shipment of one consignment (invoice) with India Post
FAQ.answer: Maximum of 10 boxes can be shipped by the Seller as part of one consignment (invoice) with India Post

FAQ.question: How can I track the shipments booked via India Post online?
FAQ.answer: Yes the status of the shipments booked via India Post online can be tracked under India Post Dashboard

FAQ.question: How can the Seller check the current status of the booking done via India Post online?
FAQ.answer: The Seller can check the current status of the booking done via India Post online by clicking on Check Status tab available in India Post Dashboard against the tracking id generated as part of the booking

FAQ.question: How can the Seller download the label to be pasted on the boxes to be shipped as part of the booking done by India Post online
FAQ.answer: The seller can download the label by clicking on Print Label tab available in India Post Dashboard

FAQ.question: Can the seller cancel the tracking id generated as part of booking done via India Post online?
FAQ.answer: Yes the seller can cancel the booking for any tracking id generated as part of the booking done via India Post online by clicking on "Cancellation" tab available in India Post Dashboard

FAQ.question: Who has to pay the Transaction Charge?
FAQ.answer: "The transaction charge will be paid by the Seller / Service Provider: a) before order acceptance in case of Direct purchase b) before invoice generation for Bid/RA orders"

FAQ.question: Is Transaction charge applicable on all Contracts?
FAQ.answer: Transaction charges would be applicable on all contracts  valued Rs.5 lacs or more after a seller reaches the Seller Merchandise Value  of INR 20 lacs as mentioned in the Transaction charges Policy.

FAQ.question: How is the Transaction charge to be paid?
FAQ.answer: The Transaction charge would be paid online. The Seller / Service Provider would have the option to pay by Net banking, NEFT, RTGS.

FAQ.question: How much is to be paid as transaction charge?
FAQ.answer: "The Transaction Charges consist of two components mentioned below. In addition, The GST of 18% would also be applicable on Transaction Charges: a) A one-time charge titled “Annual Milestone Charge” shall be levied @ 0.5% on all sellers clocking a threshold Seller Merchandise Value. of Rs. 20 lacs in each financial year. b) For all the sellers who have clocked the threshold seller merchandise value, a Transaction Charge shall be levied on all orders equal to or above Rs. 5 lakhs. For Transaction charges rates, please refer the transaction charges policy."

FAQ.question: Who is Exempted from paying the Transaction Charge?
FAQ.answer: The following Sellers/Service Providers are exempted: 1) Khadi and Village Industries Commission 2) ACASH 3) TRIFED 4) WDO 5) Coir Board

FAQ.question: Would I get the Receipt for the Transaction Charge paid to GeM?
FAQ.answer: Yes, the Seller / Service Provider will get the receipt/Tax Invoice on successful payment of the transaction charge.

FAQ.question: From when does the new Transaction charges policy become effective?
FAQ.answer: The new Transaction charges policy would become effective from 1st April 2022.

FAQ.question: Would Transaction charges be payable on contracts/bids placed before the 1st April 2022?
FAQ.answer: The new Policy of Transaction charges would become effective from 1st April 2022 and would be applicable on all orders placed on or after 1st April 2022 and all bids published on or after 1st April 2022. For all the Orders placed before 1st April 2022 and bids published before 1st April 2022, the Transaction charges as per the old Transaction charges policy would be applicable.

FAQ.question: Can the contract be accepted without paying the Transaction Charge?
FAQ.answer: In direct/ L1 purchase orders, if acceptance is required, Seller / Service Provider will not be able to accept the contract before paying the Transaction charges if the same are applicable. For direct/ L1 purchase orders where acceptance is not required or orders placed through Bid/RA, they will be deemed accepted but the Seller/Service Provider would not be able to generate the Invoice before paying the Transaction charges.

FAQ.question: How can I make the Annual Maintenance/ Transaction Charges payment?
FAQ.answer: You can pay the Annual Maintenance/ Transaction Charges w.r.t the order by clicking on Pay AMC/ TC button on the order screen. On click, you will see the payment bifurcation and a Pay now button. On click of Pay now button, you can make the payment via NEFT/ RTGS/ Net Banking mode.

FAQ.question: Can I accept or Decline an Order Placed throgh Bid/RA on GeM?
FAQ.answer: No, you cannot accept or Decline an Order placed through Bid/RA. All Orders placed through Bid/RA are deemed accepted as Seller has participated in the Bid/RA and agreed to the Terms and conditions.

FAQ.question: Can I accept or Decline a Direct Purchase Order Placed on GeM?
FAQ.answer: You can accept/ decline a Direct Purchase order in the following 2 scenarios. - If the order is placed by a red flagged buyer - If the order is freight intensive You will get 120 hours to accept/ decline the order. In case of no action, the order will be auto accepted post 120 hours.
